title: Physical states of Br2 and I2

content.question: At <math alttext="298 kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>298</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math> and <math alttext="1 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>, <math alttext="B r 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is a liquid and <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is a crystalline solid. Which of the following statements best explains the different physical states of <math alttext="B r 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> at <math alttext="298 kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>298</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math> and <math alttext="1 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>?

choices.label: The London dispersion forces among <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> molecules are stronger than those among <math alttext="B r 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> molecules.

The London dispersion forces among <math alttext="B r 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> molecules are stronger than those among <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> molecules.

The <math alttext="B r B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Br</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi>Br</mi></math> bond is stronger than the <math alttext="I I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> bond.

The <math alttext="I I " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> bond is stronger than the <math alttext="B r B r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Br</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi>Br</mi></math> bond.

content.answer: The London dispersion forces among <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> molecules are stronger than those among <math alttext="B r 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Br</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> molecules.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
